p: Although microhabitat use, foraging substrate and prey choice of the Small Tree Finch and the Warbler Finch in this study differed among the habitat conditions, prey attack rate and foraging success remained similar. However, it is possible that the prey caught in each area may differ in quality (e.g. energy content and digestibility) as shown for the Grey Partridge in herbicide controlled areas in the UK (Boutin et al. 2012), which could have both short and long-term affects on adult birds and chicks. These possibilities should be investigated in future studies.
